To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. How long wilt thou forget<S>7911</S> me, O LORD<S>3068</S>? for ever<S>5331</S>? how long wilt thou hide<S>5641</S> thy face<S>6440</S> from me? <sup>chief: or, overseer</sup>
How long shall I take<S>7896</S> counsel<S>6098</S> in my soul<S>5315</S>, having sorrow<S>3015</S> in my heart<S>3824</S> daily<S>3119</S>? how long shall mine enemy<S>341</S> be exalted<S>7311</S> over me?
Consider<S>5027</S> and hear<S>6030</S> me, O LORD<S>3068</S> my God<S>430</S>: lighten<S>215</S> mine eyes<S>5869</S>, lest I sleep<S>3462</S> the sleep of death<S>4194</S>;
Lest mine enemy<S>341</S> say<S>559</S>, I have prevailed<S>3201</S> against him; and those that trouble<S>6862</S> me rejoice<S>1523</S> when I am moved<S>4131</S>.
But I have trusted<S>982</S> in thy mercy<S>2617</S>; my heart<S>3820</S> shall rejoice<S>1523</S> in thy salvation<S>3444</S>.
I will sing<S>7891</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>, because he hath dealt bountifully<S>1580</S> with me.
